Game.Core

Interface RulesInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Rules

    public interface RulesInterface
    Interface that defines structure of the rulebook.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    vikfll-0

    • Method Detail

      • canSayUno

        boolean canSayUno(remotePlayer player)
        Checks if a player is allowed to say uno.
        Parameters:
        player - Player that is attempting to say uno
        Returns:
        true if player has 1 card left, false if player does not have 1 card in hand

      • checkWinner

        boolean checkWinner(remotePlayer player)
        Check if the player has won, hand should be empty and the player should have said uno.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to check if winner
        Returns:
        true if players hand is empty and player has said uno, false otherwise.

      • playerCanPlay

        boolean playerCanPlay(remotePlayer player,
                      Card activeCard)
        Check if a player can play with its current hand.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to check if play is available
        activeCard - The current active card
        Returns:
        True if possible, false if not

      • validStartingCard

        boolean validStartingCard(Card card)
        Check if cards is a valid starting card.
        Parameters:
        card - Card to check
        Returns:
        return true if Number card with value 0-9

      • drawStartingCard

        Card drawStartingCard(DeckInterface deck)
        Draw a startingCard from the deck.
        Parameters:
        deck - The deck to draw the startingCard from.
        Returns:
        The first card in the deck.

      • drawValidStartingCard

        Card drawValidStartingCard(DeckInterface deck)
        Draw a valid startingCard from the deck, should result in a valid card.
        Parameters:
        deck - Deck that card should be drawn from
        Returns:
        A valid card in accordance with validStartingCard method.

      • canPlayCard

        boolean canPlayCard(Card cardToPlay,
                    Card activeCard)
        Check if a card can be played on the activeCard
        Parameters:
        cardToPlay - Card that should be checked if possible to play
        activeCard - The current active card
        Returns:
        true if possible, false otherwise.

      • playerCanPlayCards

        boolean playerCanPlayCards(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardWantToPlay,
                           Card activeCard,
                           remotePlayer player)
        Check if a player can play multiple cards. Checks so that player does not finish the game by playing multiple cards and checks so that the different cards adhere to the requirements set up in the description.
        Parameters:
        cardWantToPlay - Arraylist of cards that wants to be played
        activeCard - The active card
        player - The player that wants to play the cards
        Returns:
        True if possible, false otherwise.

      • cardsToProcess

        java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardsToProcess(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardsWantToPlay)
        Defines the rules on if cards should be stackable
        Parameters:
        cardsWantToPlay - Cards want to play
        Returns:
        The cards that should be processed.

      • getStartingPlayer

        remotePlayer getStartingPlayer(java.util.ArrayList<remotePlayer> players)
        Returns the startingPlayer, current implementation sets player 0 but could be changed.
        Parameters:
        players - Arraylist of active players
        Returns:
        The starting player

      • getStartingCardAmount

        int getStartingCardAmount()
        Return the amount of cards that should be dealt to players at the start.
        Returns:
        The amount of cards to deal at the start.

      • penalizePlayer

        boolean penalizePlayer(remotePlayer player)
        Checks to see if player should be penalized for not saying uno
        Parameters:
        player - The player to check
        Returns:
        True if player has 1 card and has not said uno, false otherwise.

      • getDeck

        Deck getDeck()
        The deck that should be used
        Returns:
        A deck that the game can use.
